copyBlock.copy: Small riding lawn mowers are designed with compactness in mind, making them an ideal choice for those with limited storage space such as garages or small sheds. Their smaller size allows for easy maneuverability in tight areas, ensuring efficient lawn care even in challenging corners or narrow passages. These compact mowers are specifically engineered to fit through standard-sized garden gates and doors, eliminating the hassle of removing fences or other obstacles for storage. Additionally, their reduced dimensions make them lighter and more maneuverable, allowing for effortless navigation and convenient storage, making them a practical and space-saving solution for homeowners with limited outdoor space.

blocks.title: CC30H Mini Rider
blocks.copy: Cub Cadet small riding lawn mowers deliver the same strength, durability and perfect cut as our larger riders; but in a more compact design.

blocks.title: CC30E Mini Rider
blocks.copy: Its compact size gives you incredible maneuverability and control so you can mow through small areas like most backyard gateways.

powerLevel.h2: Power on a Whole New Level

blocks.title: Gas Engine
blocks.copy: Engine options offer smooth operation, quick acceleration with simple recovery; also available with electronic fuel injection technology (EFI) for easy startup.

blocks.title: Electric
blocks.copy: Our lithium-ion battery technology provides long runtime, quiet operation, minimal power fade, less maintenance than gas and a fast charge.

quote.title: Convenient Size, Great Power
quote.copy: “I just got the Cub Cadet CC 30 Rider with the rear engine. I love it! For it's size, it's got great power and the engine is not too loud. I had to cut some really tall and thick grass and not once did the mower bog down. The size of the mower is convenient for fitting it in the back of my Chevy Colorado pickup truck. Of course, I would love to ride one of the big Enduro tractors, but I do have some tight spots to drive around, so the CC 30 is perfect! Smooth running and powerful. And, with the engine in the rear, I don't have exhaust blowing in my face!”
quote.name: JayDawg

forEveryJob.copy: Designed to get more done season after season with a selection of attachments and accessories designed for a variety of jobs.

blocks.title: Bagger System
blocks.copy: This double bag grass collection system mounts easily to your small riding lawn mower to collect grass clippings while mowing. The vented nylon bags provide superior strength and airflow to reduce grass from clogging.

blocks.title: Hauler
blocks.copy: Designed for up to 800 pounds and built with fold-out side panels for easy loading and unloading, the hauler allows you to easily move mulch, logs and more.

blocks.title: Armrest Kit
blocks.copy: These arm rests are designed to provide support for your arms while you're mowing, allowing you to complete your job comfortably. When not in use, the armrest flips up to move out of the way.

faqs.question: Can you use a riding mower on a small yard?
faqs.answer: Riding mowers are suitable for small yards, particularly those that are one-half acre in size or larger. A small riding lawn mower can significantly speed up the mowing process. This increased cutting width allows for faster coverage and improved productivity, making the maintenance of your small yard more manageable.

faqs.question: What type of mower is recommended for a half acre?
faqs.answer: When it comes to a half-acre lawn, both small riding lawn mowers and self-propelled walk-behind mowers are viable options. Self-propelled mowers feature front or rear-powered wheels that aide in maneuvering around the yard and alleviate some of the physical effort required. They offer a convenient solution for maintaining a half-acre lawn efficiently. On the other hand, if you prefer a seated position and want to cover the area more quickly, a small riding lawn mower can also be a suitable choice. It provides comfort and convenience while navigating the yard. Cub Cadet offers two small riding lawn mowers, the Cub Cadet CC30H, and the CC30E.

faqs.question: Is a riding mower worth it for a half acre?
faqs.answer: When it comes to half-acre lawns, investing in a riding mower can be a worthwhile choice. A riding mower offers several advantages for yards of this size, including enhanced efficiency and reduced cutting time compared to a walk-behind mower. By opting for a riding mower with a 30 deck, you can significantly speed up the mowing process and cover more ground with each pass compared to a walk-behind mower. This increased cutting width allows for faster coverage and improved productivity, making the maintenance of your half-acre lawn more manageable. Cub Cadet offers two riding lawn mowers with a 30 in deck, the Cub Cadet CC30H, and the CC30E. Both models are equipped with a hitch that offers light towing capabilities and a mulch plug that prevents grass from escaping the machine, enabling it to be finely chopped into smaller pieces for use as lawn fertilizer.

faqs.question: What are the benefits of a small riding lawn mower?
faqs.answer:
Small riding lawn mowers offer several benefits. A compact design makes them highly maneuverable, allowing easy navigation around tight corners and through small gates. Benefits of the Cub Cadet CC30H and the CC30E specifically include:
  • Ability to mow through a 36” gate doorway.
  • The compact size allows for easy storage, fitting in the space of two garbage cans.
  • Rear engine/battery location allows for a better line of sight with an unobstructed view while mowing vs. a lawn tractor.

faqs.question: What is the smallest riding lawn mower?
faqs.answer: The smallest riding lawn mowers available in the Cub Cadet® lineup are the CC30H and CC30E models. These small riding lawn mowers feature a compact design and come equipped with a 30-in. cutting deck. These mowers maintain excellent maneuverability and are capable of efficiently navigating tight spaces.
